posts._title: Richard Attenborough – Oh! What a Lovely War [+Extras] (1969)
posts.title: Oh! What a Lovely War
posts.excerpt: Quote: The film, a thoroughly enjoyable ‘odd duck’, with a typical quasi-political artistic stance on the follies of war. Highly entertaining and, at times, touching. Quote: WHEN Joan Littlewood’s London improvisation, “Oh! What a Lovely War,” opened on Broadway five years ago, it had a cast of 18 men and women dressed as Pierrots and …

posts.title: Flossie
posts.excerpt: The young girl Flossie comes straight from a Swiss boarding school to Stockholm where she meets a young embassy clerk. Together with her friend Eva each tell the other two of previous sexual encounters.

posts._title: Michele Massimo Tarantini – La Liceale AKA The Teasers (1975)
posts.title: La Liceale
posts.excerpt: Italian sex-comedy starring the lovely Gloria Guida. Loredana (Guida) is a schoolgirl who takes advantage of her fellow students and teachers by using her innocent schoolgirl beauty. After she loses her virginity to an older man she soon realizes there are more important things to life than teasing men. Also stars Giuseppe Pambieri, Ilona Staller, …

posts._title: Jonas Middleton – Through The Looking Glass (1976)
posts.title: Through The Looking Glass
posts.excerpt: Without question one of the true classics of hardcore, Through the Looking Glass is yet another perfect example (like Café Flesh or even Thundercrack) of how porn can be used to craft and/or embellish a film so it works as erotica as well as a legitimate movie. Also released in a highly successful ‘R’ rated …

posts.title: Polytechnique
posts.excerpt: Polytechnique is an audio-visual collaboration between Italian ambient/drone musician, Easychord and UK filmmaker, Scott Barley. The film is best viewed in a dark room with a quality sound system or headphones. Guided by Easychord’s haunting, bodily piece, the visuals attempt to explore and invoke the concepts of prisoner’s cinema, stream of consciousness, repetition, the primordial …

posts._title: Jemaine Clement & Taika Waititi – What We Do in the Shadows (2014)
posts.title: What We Do in the Shadows
posts.excerpt: One of the funnest films of 2014 is misfit-vampire-roommate mockumentary “What We Do In The Shadows” Quote: Follow the lives of Viago (Taika Waititi), Deacon (Jonathan Brugh), and Vladislav (Jemaine Clement) – three flatmates who are just trying to get by and overcome life’s obstacles-like being immortal vampires who must feast on human blood. Hundreds …

posts._title: Philippe Garrel – Elle a Passé Tant d’Heures Sous les Sunlights… AKA She Spent So Many Hours Under the Sun Lamps (1985)
posts.title: Elle a Passé Tant d’Heures Sous les Sunlights…
posts.excerpt: Quote: Faceted, fragmented, and oneiric, Philippe Garrel’s Elle a passé tant d’heures sous les sunlights… (She Spent So Many Hours Under the Sun Lamps) is more exorcism than expurgation, elegy than lamentation – an abstract, yet lucid chronicle of love and loss, death and birth sublimated through textural, self-reflexive impressions, visceral gestures, and metaphoric tableaux. …
posts.titleEnglish: She Spent So Many Hours Under the Sun Lamps

posts._title: Chantal Akerman – Je, tu, il, elle aka I, You, He, She (1975)
posts.title: Je, tu, il, elle
posts.excerpt: Criterion wrote: In her provocative first feature, Chantal Akerman stars as an aimless young woman who leaves self-imposed isolation to embark on a road trip that leads to lonely love affairs with a male truck driver and a former girlfriend. With its famous real-time carnal encounter and its daring minimalism, Je tu il elle is …

posts._title: Levon Grigoryan – Andrei Tarkovsky & Sergei Parajanov – Islands (1988)
posts.title: Andrei Tarkovsky & Sergei Parajanov – Islands
posts.excerpt: Description: A 40 minute documentary discussing the friendship of Tarkovsky and Parajanov and their contrasting filmmaking styles and personalities, including interviews with friends and associates.

posts._title: Michael Pressman – The Great Texas Dynamite Chase (1976)
posts.title: The Great Texas Dynamite Chase
posts.excerpt: The Great Texas Dynamite Chase is a well-made exploitation film which works on two levels, providing kicks for the ozoner crowd and tongue-in-cheek humor for the more sophisticated. The film had some initial playdates under the title Dynamite Women. Claudia Jennings and Jocelyn Jones are stylish and attractive as a pair of brazen Texas bankrobbers. …
